Header: Jesper Asselman wins stage one of the Tour de Yorkshire
Content: Dutch rider Jesper Asselman won the final sprint to take stage one victory at the Tour de Yorkshire in four hours, five minutes and 45 seconds. The Roompot-Charles cyclist was part of a long-range breakway in cold and wet conditions, and timed his sprint well to hold off the fast-closing Filippo Fortin.Four-time Tour de France champion Chris Froome, who was making his debut at this event finished back in the pack. It was his first race competing for Team Ineos, since their official launch switch from Team Sky on Wednesday.
